item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Why didn't I learn to treat everything like it was the last time. My greatest regret was how much I believed in the future." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I leave Sisyphus at the foot of the mountain. One always finds one's burden again. But Sisyphus teaches the higher fidelity that negates the gods and raises rocks. He too concludes that all is well. This universe henceforth without a master seems to him neither sterile nor futile. Each atom of that stone, each mineral flake of that night-filled mountain, in itself, forms a world. The struggle itself toward the heights is enough to fill a man's heart. One must imagine Sisyphus happy." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "And he knew, also, what the old man was thinking as his tears flowed, and he, Rieux, thought it too: that a loveless world is a dead world, and always there comes an hour when one is weary of prisons, of one's work, and of devotion to duty, and all one craves for is a loved face, the warmth and wonder of a loving heart." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Give her hell from us, Peeves." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To hurt is as human as to breathe." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it)." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.K. Rowling
Rachel add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "It is very difficult to be wholly joyous or wholly sad on this earth." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "There is something haunting in the light of the moon; it has all the dispassionateness of a disembodied soul, and something of its inconceivable mystery." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Like a running blaze on a plain, like a flash of lightning in the clouds. We live in the flicker." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "Making itself intelligible is suicide for philosophy." -- Martin Heidegger

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "Every man is born as many men and dies as a single one. " -- Martin Heidegger

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Witold Gombrowicz
item.description: "For Kierkegaard, for Heidegger, for Sartre, the more profound the awareness, the more authentic the existence. They measure honesty and the essence of experience by the degree of awareness. But is our humanity really built on awareness? Doesn't awareness--that forced, extreme awareness--arise among us, not from us, as something created by effort, the mutual perfecting of ourselves in it, the confirming of something that one philosopher forces onto another? Isn't man, therefore, in his private reality, something childish and always beneath his own awareness? And doesn't he feel awareness to be, at the same time, something alien, imposed and unimportant? If this is how it is, this furtive childhood, this concealed degradation are ready to explode your systems sooner or later." -- Witold Gombrowicz

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Everything has been figured out, except how to live." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "There is a universe behind and before him. And the day is approaching when closing the last book on the last shelf on the far left; he will say to himself, "now what?" -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Three o'clock is always too late or too early for anything you want to do." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "If I became a philosopher, if I have so keenly sought this fame for which I'm still waiting, it's all been to seduce women basically." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Walter Kaufmann
item.description: "Man stands alone in the universe, responsible for his condition, likely to remain in a lowly state, but free to reach above the stars." -- Walter Kaufmann

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "How terribly sad it was that people are made in such a way that they get used to something as extraordinary as living." -- Jostein Gaarder

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Jostein Gaarder
item.description: "When you realize there is something you don't understand, then you're generally on the right path to understanding all kinds of things." -- Jostein Gaarder
